results.name: Pendular Catalan triangle, read by rows, where row n is formed from row n-1 by the recurrence: if n > 2k, T(n,k) = T(n,n-k) + T(n-1,k), else T(n,k) = T(n,n-1-k) - T(n-1,k) - T(n-1,k+1), for n>=k>=0, with T(n,0)=1 and T(n,n)=0^n.
comment: See A118340 for definition of pendular triangles and pendular sums.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..50 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(2*n+m, n) = [A000108^(m+1)](n), i.e., the m-th lower semi-diagonal forms the self-convolution (m+1)-power of A000108.
example: Row 6 equals the pendular sums of row 5:
[1,  4,  5,  3,  1,  0], where the sums proceed as follows:
[1,  5,  9,  5,  4,  1,  0] finally, append a zero to obtain row 6.
Central terms are Catalan numbers T(2*n,n) = A000108(n);
semi-diagonals form successive self-convolutions of the central terms:
maple: elif n>2*k then T(n, n-k) +T(n-1, k);
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021 *)
program: else: return T(n, n-k-1) -T(n-1, k) -T(n-1, k+1)
flatten([[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021
